verses.kjv: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?
verses.ct: Why doesn't the Almighty set specific times for judgment? Why do those who are devoted to him never get to see his days of justice?

verses.kjv: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.
verses.ct: Wicked people move boundary markers to steal land. They seize flocks and graze them as their own.

verses.kjv: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
verses.ct: They take the donkey that belongs to orphans. They demand a widow's ox as collateral for a debt.

verses.kjv: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
verses.ct: They shove the poor off the road. The vulnerable people of the land are forced into hiding together.

verses.kjv: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.
verses.ct: Look — like wild donkeys in the wasteland, the poor go out searching for work. They get up early hunting for food; the desert is all that provides for them and their children.

verses.kjv: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.
verses.ct: They harvest grain in fields that aren't theirs, and they pick the leftover grapes in the vineyards of the wicked.

verses.kjv: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
verses.ct: They make people sleep without clothes, leaving them with nothing to cover themselves against the cold.

verses.kjv: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
verses.ct: They are drenched by mountain rainstorms and press against the rocks because they have no shelter.

verses.kjv: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.
verses.ct: They snatch orphaned infants from their mothers' arms and take the babies of the poor as security for debts.

verses.kjv: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;
verses.ct: They force people to walk around without clothing, and they seize the harvested grain from those who are starving.

verses.kjv: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
verses.ct: The poor press olive oil within the oppressors' walls and crush grapes in their winepresses, yet go thirsty themselves.

verses.kjv: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.
verses.ct: The dying groan from within the city, and the souls of the wounded cry out for help — yet God doesn't charge anyone with wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.
verses.ct: Then there are those who rebel against the light. They refuse to understand its ways or stay on its paths.

verses.kjv: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.
verses.ct: The murderer gets up at dawn to kill the poor and helpless, and at night he operates like a thief.

verses.kjv: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.
verses.ct: The adulterer watches for twilight, thinking, 'No one will see me,' and he covers his face with a disguise.

verses.kjv: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.
verses.ct: Under cover of darkness they break into houses that they scouted during the day. They want nothing to do with the light.

verses.kjv: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
verses.ct: For all of them, morning is like deep darkness — they are completely at home with the terrors of the night.

verses.kjv: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
verses.ct: They are swept away quickly like something carried on floodwaters. Their share of the land is cursed. They never walk the path toward the vineyards.

verses.kjv: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.
verses.ct: Just as drought and heat dry up melted snow, so the grave swallows up those who have sinned.

verses.kjv: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
verses.ct: Even his own mother will forget him. Worms will feast on him. No one will remember him anymore. Wickedness will be snapped like a tree.

verses.kjv: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.
verses.ct: He mistreats the childless woman who cannot have children, and he shows no kindness to the widow.

verses.kjv: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.
verses.ct: Yet God drags away the powerful by his strength. They may rise up, but they can never be certain they will survive.

verses.kjv: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.
verses.ct: God may let them feel secure and comfortable, but his eyes are watching everything they do.

verses.kjv: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
verses.ct: They are lifted up for a short time, but then they are gone — brought low and gathered up like everyone else, cut off like the tops of grain stalks.

verses.kjv: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
verses.ct: If this isn't true, then who can prove me wrong and show that what I've said is worthless?
